abstract_summ: 18 out of the 88 patients developed cutaneous manifestations, but only 8 patients developed skin lesions at onset of disease.Since the beginning of the pandemic of Coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) an increasing number of skin manifestations have been reported.(1,2) Most reports concern adult patients and describe various patterns of skin eruptions, in most of cases with low specificity and no univocal temporal association with the onset of systemic symptoms of COVID‐19.(1‐3)The novel Coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) outbreak has been recently declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO), being Italy and Spain the worst‐hit European countries.Many clinical manifestations of the virus are described, and new symptoms are emerging, only few cases of patients with skin manifestation were described since the pandemic was announced by the WHO on March.Herein we present two patients with urticarial vasculitis arising in the context of COVID‐19 infection.Recalcati (2020), for example, reported that 20.4% of 88 COVID‐19 patients presented cutaneous manifestations such as erythematous rash, generalized urticaria and vesicles.

title_abstract_phrases: 18 out of the 88 patients developed cutaneous manifestations, but only 8 patients developed skin lesions at onset of disease.It has already been described how purple in children, when accompanied by fever, can be a rare but possible manifestation of novel SARs-CoV2 infection(4).Papular‐purpuric exanthem in a COVID‐19 patient: clinical and dermoscopic descriptionAcute Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has become a global health concern associated with a broad spectrum of clinical presentations.Histologic features of long lasting chilblain‐like lesions in a pediatric COVID‐19 patientSince the beginning of the pandemic of Coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) an increasing number of skin manifestations have been reported.(1,2) Most reports concern adult patients and describe various patterns of skin eruptions, in most of cases with low specificity and no univocal temporal association with the onset of systemic symptoms of COVID‐19.(1‐3)Urticarial vasculitis in COVID‐19 infection: a vasculopathy‐related symptom?The novel Coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) outbreak has been recently declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO), being Italy and Spain the worst‐hit European countries.Viral Exanthem with “Pin and Needles Sensation” on Extremities of COVID-19 PatientAbstract Cutaneous manifestation is a newly reported clinical manifestation of COVID-19 infection.al (2020) described three patients who developed oral ulcerative lesions during the COVID‐19 lock‐down period; a 56‐year‐old healthy male, a 58‐year‐old‐male with diabetes and hypertension and a 65‐year‐old female with hypertension.
